item.title: Programming : Spelling Rules and Operatos : 1
item.description: Basic Conditions for Programming Statements Explain the given basic orders and commands. For example printf command is a direct command and an order but like this int main() commands can not to be a statement. End of the sentence there has to be ; (semicolon). Finally this is an atomic property. Blocks Used for view multiple statements as a general group. A group is shown between of { ... }the 2 curly brackets.

item.title: Programming : Introduction to C Programing
item.description: A Traditional Example : Hello World! 1#include <stdio.h> 2//#include <conio.h> (This library for the Windows users) 3 4int main() 5{ 6 printf("Hello World!"); 7 printf("\n"); 8 //getch (); (This fonction for the Windows users) 9 return 0; 10} A library is included in the program with #include <libraryname>. The task of the libraries are to be the source for the use of the necessay functions. In the simplest example; the C is can not include the printf function but the libray of stdio.

item.title: Programming : Introduction to Programming
item.description: Programs What Is The Program? The meaning of the program is hardware-specific executable text. If examine the working of a program with an example: When run a program with .exe(that is .exe on win OS(Operation System)) extension or another a program extension in any operation system, this program sends certain commands to the systems processor and program works. (This steps for the same systems like computers, tablets, smartphones, etc.) These stages means are programming.
